$interpreted: Nigel: This is what you asked for, isn't it?
Sherlock: Yessiree, perfect~ Whoop whoop, Lisa will...
Angelia: Lisa?
Sherlock: Nothing. The thingamabob Theodore purchased that you're dying to see, here you are.
Nigel: What the hell is this?!
Sherlock: The blueprint I sold Theodore. A customized cannon for the castle. All hail the almighty Rayzor!
Sherlock: I'm not a kleptomaniac, but I couldn't resist~ A farewell present to myself when I bid adieu to the Mechanical Territory~
Angelia: Seriously? A CANNON?!
Sherlock: Rayzor is no ordinary cannon, it'll blow you all to Kingdom come! Even if all a King's horses and all a King's men tried to attack the castle,
Sherlock: once Rayzor's in motion there's no putting anyone back together again! Blasted to smithereens, that is.
Naya: You have got to be kidding me!
Sherlock: Don't dismiss the power of mechanical technology so flippantly.

Sherlock: The only issue with Rayzor is the enormous amount of compressed Soul Energy input required to create such destructive power. 
Theodore assured me that this wouldn't be a problem...
Angelia: The Dragoneye Gem?!

Sherlock: Yes, the thing they dug up from Atlas. Rumor has it,
infinite Soul Energy resides within the artifact.
Sherlock: If this urban legend is not a myth, Rayzor would have unlimited ammunition!
Naya: Oh you brute, how could you? How could you give Theodore such a terrifying thing?!
Sherlock: What's the problem? This Rayzor isn't exactly lightweight. It simply isn't possible to keep moving it around.
Sherlock: At most, it's a device for self-defense.
Angelia: But, what if the castle...could fly?
Sherlock: If the castle could fly? Good golly miss molly, conquering nations would be as easy as picking up curren off the ground. Just think about that!
Sherlock: The world would be your own little piggy bank!
Sherlock: Now that our little troubleshooting session is over, I've got business to attend to.
Sherlock: Got to buy a few more gears to replace the ones you ruined. Goodbye!
Nigel: Here's your proof, the ugly truth. If this doesn't convince you, I don't know what will.
Angelia: Impossible...the uncle I've come to know could not have such sinister intentions...
Nigel: Are you still in denial, despite all of this?!
Naya: Hey! What's with the temper, can't you give Angel a little more time to take this all in?
Nigel: We can't afford to throw tantrums now!
Nigel: The castle's reconstruction is almost complete. According to my intel, on Kingdom of the Sun's two hundredth anniversary,
Nigel: Theodore's planning to launch the maiden voyage of the castle with all nobles as witness. Perhaps even show off Rayzor.
Naya: Are you implying Rayzor will be used to declare war on the other nations? Does he recognize the consequences?

Nigel: Theodore, being the slick talker he is, will certainly
have no problem coming up with excuses.
Nigel: After the display of power, others will definitely kowtow in fear. That's his personal agenda.
Naya: Could His Majesty's plans really be so evil...?
Angelia: Two hundredth Anniversary...could it be? My twentieth birthday?
Nigel: Theodore will lose his power over the Kingdom once you come of age. That is why I need you.
Angelia: You want me to announce to the nobles that the throne is mine and prevent Rayzor from ever possibly attacking another nation?
Nigel: Compared to a break and enter approach, which would result in innocent bloodshed,
Nigel: I believe this is the most peaceful way to proceed.
Angelia: ...This is not the uncle I came to love...yet, if uncle truly has a hidden dark side...
Angelia: Fine, I accept your proposal!
Nigel: You were always destined for greatness.
Angelia: My twentieth birthday is less than ten days from now. What do you suggest?
Nigel: It takes about that much time to make it back there. We don't have time to dillydally.
Nigel: Yamitsuki will take care of everything else. We'll figure out how to sneak inside later on.
Naya: Straight into action upon arrival? No time to notify dear Sione...
Angelia: I grew up in the castle. I know that place like the back of my hand.
Angelia: It won't be hard to get inside.
Nigel: So...we're on the same side now, wouldn't you say?
